div.p: No. 57/3700, unit 4, p. 241, VPRS 975/P1 outward registered correspondence, VA 669 Public Works Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

In acknowledging the receipt of your letter of the 10th Inst
See M to D. Moore, 10 November 1857. suggesting that during the approaching hot season a covering of calico be stretched over and around the new Conservatory of the Botanic Gardens, I have the honor to inform you that a letter has been addressed to the Treasury for the transfer of the sum of £50 from the vote for "Tools" to meet the expense of this addition and other charges.
